3:58 PM

Ah! You want to extend the operation vocabulary dynamically based on Adapter functions. Brilliant!

Conceptual Flow

User calls: run("get_post", { id: 1 })
              ↓
Is "get_post" a built-in operation? No
              ↓
Look up operation→adapter mapping
              ↓
Find "get_post" → JSONPlaceholder adapter
              ↓
Load adapter (if not cached)
              ↓
Execute adapter.functions.get_post(run_doc)
              ↓
Function returns run_doc with populated target
              ↓
Return result with target.data

What You Need (Using Current Architecture)

1. Operation→Adapter Mapping Table

Store in a doctype like "OperationMapping":

javascript
{
  doctype: "OperationMapping",
  operation: "get_post",
  adapter_name: "JSONPlaceholder",  // Which adapter owns this op
  is_default: 0  // If 1, this is the fallback adapter for unknown ops
}

2. Extend Resolver

In _resolveAll(), when operation is unknown:

javascript
// If not a built-in operation
if (!cfg.operations[resolved.operation]) {
  // Look up custom operation mapping
  const mapping = await lookupOperationMapping(resolved.operation);
  
  if (mapping) {
    resolved.adapter_name = mapping.adapter_name;
    resolved.operation_type = "adapter_function";
  }
}

3. Adapter Cache in run_doc

javascript
run_doc.adapter = {
  name: "JSONPlaceholder",
  config: { base_url: "...", timeout: 5000 },
  functions: { get_post: <callable>, create_post: <callable> }
}

4. Handler for Adapter Functions

javascript
coworker._handlers.adapter_function = async function(run_doc) {
  const { operation, adapter } = run_doc;
  
  // Execute the adapter function
  const fn = adapter.functions[operation];
  if (!fn) throw new Error(`Function ${operation} not found in adapter`);
  
  // Function modifies run_doc.target in place
  await fn(run_doc);
  
  // Ensure target schema is loaded
  if (run_doc.target?.doctype && !run_doc.target.schema) {
    run_doc.target.schema = await coworker.getSchema(run_doc.target.doctype);
  }
  
  return {
    success: true,
    output: run_doc.target  // Return the target populated by function
  };
};

5. Pre-execution in Controller

Before executing, if operation_type === "adapter_function":

javascript
// Load adapter if not present
if (!run_doc.adapter) {
  const adapterRun = await coworker.run({
    operation: "takeone",
    doctype: "Adapter",
    query: { where: { adapter_name: resolved.adapter_name } }
  });
  
  run_doc.adapter = {
    name: adapterRun.output.data[0].adapter_name,
    config: JSON.parse(adapterRun.output.data[0].config),
    functions: deserializeAndActivate(adapterRun.output.data[0].functions)
  };
}

Key Insights

  1. No new syntax - Just run("get_post", { id: 1 })
  2. Lazy loading - Adapters loaded on first use, then cached
  3. Schema auto-fetch - When function sets target.doctype, schema loads automatically
  4. Reuses existing - Controller, handlers, schema system all work as-is
  5. Default adapter - If no mapping exists, fall back to adapter with is_default: 1

The beauty: Your adapter functions become first-class operations in the coworker vocabulary!

Close. but we use await coworker.run({ operation: "update", doctype: "Adapter", query: { where: { adapter_name: "JSONPlaceholder" }}, input: { is_default: 1 },

}); is_default inside the Adapter

4:26 PM

Perfect! So the concept is:

Adapter-Based Operation Resolution

1. Adapter Schema Extension

javascript
{
  _schema_doctype: "Adapter",
  fields: [
    { fieldname: "adapter_name", fieldtype: "Data", reqd: 1, unique: 1 },
    { fieldname: "is_default", fieldtype: "Check", default: 0, label: "Default Adapter" },
    { fieldname: "operations", fieldtype: "Code", options: "JSON", label: "Operations" },
    // operations: ["get_post", "create_post", "update_post"]
    { fieldname: "config", fieldtype: "Code", options: "JSON" },
    { fieldname: "functions", fieldtype: "Code", options: "JSON" }
  ]
}
```

### 2. **Operation Resolution Flow**
```
run("get_post", { id: 1 })
  ↓
Is "get_post" built-in? No
  ↓
Query: SELECT * FROM Adapter WHERE operations LIKE '%get_post%'
  ↓
Found? Use that adapter
Not found? Use WHERE is_default = 1
  ↓
Load adapter.functions.get_post
  ↓
Execute function(run_doc)
  ↓
Function populates run_doc.target
  ↓
Auto-fetch target schema if needed
  ↓
Return run_doc

3. Key Design Points

  • Operation lives inside Adapter record - No separate mapping table
  • is_default flag - One adapter handles unknown operations
  • Adapter caching - Once loaded, keep in memory
  • Function execution context - Function receives full run_doc, modifies target
  • Schema auto-loading - When target.doctype is set, schema fetches automatically

4. What Changes in Your Code

In _resolveAll():

  • Check if operation exists in built-in operations
  • If not, mark as resolved.operation_type = "adapter_function"

In controller.execute():

  • Before handler execution, if operation_type === "adapter_function":
    • Find adapter that owns this operation
    • Load and cache adapter
    • Attach to run_doc.adapter

New handler:

  • _handlers.adapter_function executes the function from run_doc.adapter.functions[operation]

Clean, self-contained, no hooks needed!

will it correctly pull config from its Adapter doc as its needed (or its using run_doc which parsed earlier)

4:28 PM

Great question! Let's trace the data flow:

Config Access Pattern

Scenario 1: Function accesses run_doc.adapter.config

javascript
// Inside adapter function (from Adapter.functions)
async function get_post(run_doc) {
  const response = await fetch(
    run_doc.adapter.config.base_url + '/posts/' + run_doc.input.id
  );
  // ...
}

Yes, this works! Because:

  1. Controller loads adapter before execution:
javascript
// In controller.execute(), before calling handler
if (operation_type === "adapter_function") {
  const adapterDoc = await findAdapter(operation);  // Query Adapter table
  
  run_doc.adapter = {
    name: adapterDoc.adapter_name,
    config: JSON.parse(adapterDoc.config),  // ← Parsed HERE
    functions: deserialize(adapterDoc.functions)
  };
}
  1. Function receives run_doc with pre-parsed config:
javascript
run_doc.adapter = {
  name: "JSONPlaceholder",
  config: {  // ← Already parsed object
    base_url: "https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com",
    timeout: 5000
  }
}

Scenario 2: What if config changes between calls?

Problem: Adapter config is cached in memory, won't reflect DB updates.

Solutions using what you have:

  1. Cache with TTL - Reload adapter every N minutes
  2. Explicit reload - run("reload_adapter", { adapter_name: "X" })
  3. Version field - Track config_version, reload if changed
  4. No cache for config - Always query fresh (parse functions once, query config each time)

Recommended Approach

javascript
// Hybrid: Cache functions (heavy), fresh config (light)
run_doc.adapter = {
  name: "JSONPlaceholder",
  
  // Cached (functions are expensive to parse/eval)
  functions: cachedFunctions,
  
  // Fresh (query each time, it's just JSON.parse)
  get config() {
    return getCurrentConfig(this.name);  // Quick DB lookup
  }
};

This way:

  • Functions: Parse once, reuse (expensive eval)
  • Config: Always fresh (cheap JSON.parse)

Does this match your needs, or do you want config cached too?

i think we broke the path run_doc.adapter adapter should be under options in run() it was a dicision

4:30 PM

You're absolutely right! Looking back at your code:

javascript
// From coworker-run.js
coworker._exec = async function (run_doc) {
  const previousAdapter = pb._currentAdapter;
  if (run_doc.options?.adapter) {  // ← HERE
    pb.useAdapter(run_doc.options.adapter);
  }
  // ...
}

And in the child factory:

javascript
run_doc.child = async (cfg) => {
  const childRun = await coworker.run({
    ...cfg,
    options: {
      adapter: run_doc.options?.adapter,  // ← Inherited here
      ...cfg.options,
      parentRunId: run_doc.name,
    },
  });
  // ...
};

So the correct structure is:

javascript
await coworker.run({
  operation: "get_post",
  input: { id: 1 },
  options: {
    adapter: "JSONPlaceholder"  // ← Adapter name goes here
  }
});

Then in the handler, you'd load the full adapter document:

javascript
coworker._handlers.adapter_function = async function(run_doc) {
  const adapterName = run_doc.options.adapter;
  
  // Load full adapter doc (with config, functions)
  const adapterDoc = await loadAdapterDoc(adapterName);
  
  // Execute function
  const fn = adapterDoc.functions[run_doc.operation];
  fn(run_doc);  // Function has access to full run_doc
  
  // ...
};

Benefits of options.adapter:

  • Consistent with existing pattern
  • Inherits to child runs automatically
  • Keeps run_doc structure clean
  • Already used for adapter switching

Good catch!

lets first identify how and where to implement in run () JSON.stringify is if db adapter levels, handlers or somewhere else.

5:08 PM

Great question! Let's trace where serialization happens in your current architecture:

Current Serialization Points

1. Handler Level (coworker-run.js)

javascript
coworker._handlers.create = async function (run_doc) {
  // ...
  const processedDoc = await coworker.processDocument(run_doc);
  
  // Direct to _dbCreate - NO serialization here
  const result = await coworker._dbCreate(processedDoc);
  // processedDoc = { config: {...}, functions: {...} } ← Objects

2. DB Adapter Level (pb-adapter-pocketbase.js)

javascript
async create(doctype, data) {
  const collection = this.getCollection(doctype);
  
  // PocketBase SDK handles serialization internally
  const record = await pb.collection(collection).create(data);
  // SDK does: JSON.stringify(data) before HTTP request

3. Field Type Handlers (coworker-field-system.js)

javascript
coworker._fieldHandlers = {
  Code: {
    postprocess({ val, field }) {
      // IF field.options === "JSON" and val is object
      if (field.options === "JSON" && typeof val === "object") {
        return JSON.stringify(val);  // ← Should be HERE
      }
      return val;
    }
  }
}

Where It SHOULD Happen

Answer: Field Type Handlers (Tier 2)

Why?

  1. Type-aware - Only "Code" fields with options: "JSON" get serialized
  2. Bidirectional - preprocess deserializes on read, postprocess serializes on write
  3. Consistent - All handlers use same logic
  4. DB-agnostic - Works with any adapter (PocketBase, IndexedDB, SQL)

Implementation

javascript
// In coworker-field-system.js
coworker._fieldHandlers.Code = {
  preprocess({ val, field }) {
    // On READ: Deserialize JSON strings
    if (field.options === "JSON" && typeof val === "string") {
      try {
        return JSON.parse(val);
      } catch {
        return val;  // Keep as-is if not valid JSON
      }
    }
    return val;
  },
  
  postprocess({ val, field }) {
    // On WRITE: Serialize objects to JSON strings
    if (field.options === "JSON" && typeof val === "object" && val !== null) {
      return JSON.stringify(val);
    }
    return val;
  }
};

Why NOT at other levels?

  • Handler: Too high-level, doesn't know field types
  • DB Adapter: Too low-level, shouldn't know about field semantics
  • Manual in code: Error-prone, inconsistent

Tier 2 Field Handlers are the correct abstraction layer for type-specific serialization.

Does this align with your architecture vision?

my field system is 

// ============================================================================
// COWORKER-FIELD-SYSTEM.JS
// Three-tier document processing system
// ============================================================================

// ============================================================================
// TIER 1: SYSTEM FIELD RULES
// ============================================================================

coworker._applySystemFieldRules = async function(run_doc) {
  const { operation } = run_doc;
  
  // Get the correct doctype based on operation
  const doctype = run_doc.target_doctype || run_doc.source_doctype;
  
  // Get the document being processed
  const doc = run_doc.input?.data;
  if (!doc) {
    throw new Error('No document data in run_doc.input.data');
  }
  
  // Fetch schema - check output first (if already fetched), then fetch if needed
  let schema = run_doc.output?.schema;
  if (!schema) {
    schema = await this.getSchema(doctype);
    // Store it in run_doc for reuse (but not in output yet)
    run_doc._schema = schema;
  }

  // Get applicable rules, sorted by priority
  const rules = Object.entries(this._systemFieldRules || {})
    .filter(([fname, rule]) => {
      if (!rule) return false;

      if (rule.applies_to === 'all') return true;
      if (rule.applies_to === 'specific') {
        return rule.specific_doctypes?.includes(doctype);
      }
      if (rule.applies_to === 'submittable') return schema?.is_submittable;
      if (rule.applies_to === 'child_tables') return schema?.istable;

      return false;
    })
    .sort((a, b) => (a[1].priority || 100) - (b[1].priority || 100));

  // Apply each rule
  for (const [fieldname, rule] of rules) {
    // Auto-generate value
    if (rule.auto_set_on === operation || rule.auto_set_on === 'both') {
      if (rule.generator && doc[fieldname] == null) {
        doc[fieldname] = await rule.generator({ 
          doc, 
          operation, 
          doctype,
          run_doc,
          user: run_doc.owner,
          schema
        });
      } else if (rule.defaultValue && doc[fieldname] == null) {
        doc[fieldname] = rule.defaultValue;
      } else if (rule.defaultFn && doc[fieldname] == null) {
        doc[fieldname] = await rule.defaultFn({ doc, run_doc, schema });
      }
    }

    // Validate required
    if (rule.required_on === 'always' || rule.required_on === operation) {
      if (doc[fieldname] == null || doc[fieldname] === '') {
        throw new Error(`${fieldname} is required`);
      }
    }

    // Custom validation
    if (rule.validate) {
      const error = await rule.validate({ 
        val: doc[fieldname], 
        doc, 
        operation, 
        doctype,
        run_doc,
        schema
      });
      if (error) throw new Error(error);
    }
  }

  console.log(`  ✅ Tier 1: Applied ${rules.length} system field rules`);
};


// ============================================================================
// TIER 2: FIELD TYPE HANDLERS
// ============================================================================

coworker._applyFieldTypeHandlers = async function(run_doc) {
  const doctype = run_doc.target_doctype || run_doc.source_doctype;
  const doc = run_doc.input?.data;
  
  if (!doc) {
    throw new Error('No document data in run_doc.input.data');
  }
  
  // Get schema from run_doc or fetch it
  let schema = run_doc.output?.schema || run_doc._schema;
  if (!schema) {
    schema = await this.getSchema(doctype);
    run_doc._schema = schema;
  }

  if (!schema?.fields) return;

  let processedCount = 0;

  for (const field of schema.fields) {
    const handler = this._fieldHandlers?.[field.fieldtype];
    if (!handler) continue;

    const val = doc[field.fieldname];

    // Preprocess (normalize/cast)
    if (handler.preprocess) {
      doc[field.fieldname] = handler.preprocess({ 
        val, 
        field, 
        doc,
        doctype,
        run_doc
      });
    }

    // Postprocess (transform before save)
    if (handler.postprocess) {
      doc[field.fieldname] = handler.postprocess({
        val: doc[field.fieldname],
        field,
        doc,
        doctype,
        run_doc
      });
    }

    // Sync validation
    if (handler.validate) {
      const error = handler.validate(doc[field.fieldname], field);
      if (error) throw new Error(`${field.fieldname}: ${error}`);
    }

    // Async validation
    if (handler.validateAsync) {
      const error = await handler.validateAsync({
        val: doc[field.fieldname],
        field,
        doc,
        doctype,
        run_doc
      });
      if (error) throw new Error(`${field.fieldname}: ${error}`);
    }

    processedCount++;
  }

  console.log(`  ✅ Tier 2: Processed ${processedCount} fields`);
};


// ============================================================================
// TIER 3: CUSTOM FIELD RULES (PLACEHOLDER)
// ============================================================================

coworker._applyCustomFieldRules = async function(run_doc) {
  // Tier 3: Custom business rules
  // This is where you would add:
  // - Computed fields (e.g., total = quantity * rate)
  // - Cross-field validation (e.g., end_date > start_date)
  // - Domain-specific business logic
  
  const doctype = run_doc.target_doctype || run_doc.source_doctype;
  const doc = run_doc.input?.data;
  
  if (!doc) {
    throw new Error('No document data in run_doc.input.data');
  }
  
  // Example: Add custom rules here when needed
  // if (doctype === 'Invoice') {
  //   doc.total = doc.quantity * doc.rate;
  // }
  
  console.log(`  ⏭️  Tier 3: Custom rules (not implemented)`);
};


// ============================================================================
// MAIN PROCESSOR
// ============================================================================

coworker.processDocument = async function(run_doc) {
  const { operation } = run_doc;
  const doctype = run_doc.target_doctype || run_doc.source_doctype;
  
  // Validate we have document data
  if (!run_doc.input?.data) {
    throw new Error('run_doc.input.data is required for document processing');
  }
  
  console.log(`🔧 Processing document: ${doctype} (${operation})`);

  // All tiers receive run_doc
  await this._applySystemFieldRules(run_doc);
  await this._applyFieldTypeHandlers(run_doc);
  await this._applyCustomFieldRules(run_doc);

  console.log(`✅ Document processed: ${run_doc.input.data.name || 'unnamed'}`);

  return run_doc.input.data;  // Return the processed document
};


// ============================================================================
// CREATE HANDLER
// ============================================================================

coworker._handlers.create = async function (run_doc) {
  const { target_doctype, input, options } = run_doc;
  const { includeSchema = true, includeMeta = false } = options || {};

  // ✅ Accept both wrapped (input.data) and unwrapped (input) formats
  const inputData = input?.data || input;

  if (!inputData || Object.keys(inputData).length === 0) {
    throw new Error("CREATE requires input with data");
  }

  // Ensure input.data exists with doctype for 3-tier system
  run_doc.input = run_doc.input || {};
  run_doc.input.data = {
    ...inputData,
    doctype: target_doctype
  };

  // ✅ RUN THE 3-TIER ENGINE (pass run_doc)
  const processedDoc = await coworker.processDocument(run_doc);

  // Execute via adapter
  const result = await coworker._dbCreate(processedDoc);

  // Store schema in output if we fetched it
  const schema = run_doc._schema || (includeSchema ? await coworker.getSchema(target_doctype) : undefined);

  return {
    success: true,
    output: {
      data: [result.data],
      schema: includeSchema ? schema : undefined,
      meta: includeMeta ? { operation: 'create', created: 1 } : undefined
    }
  };
};


// ============================================================================
// INITIALIZATION
// ============================================================================

console.log('✅ Field system loaded (3-tier processing)');
5:10 PM

Perfect! Your field system already has the right structure. Now let's identify where JSON serialization should happen:

Answer: Tier 2 Field Type Handlers

You need to register a handler for the Code fieldtype:

javascript
// In coworker-field-system.js or separate registration file

coworker._fieldHandlers = coworker._fieldHandlers || {};

coworker._fieldHandlers.Code = {
  // On READ (select/takeone): Parse JSON strings to objects
  preprocess({ val, field }) {
    if (field.options === "JSON" && typeof val === "string") {
      try {
        return JSON.parse(val);
      } catch (e) {
        console.warn(`Failed to parse JSON for ${field.fieldname}:`, e);
        return val;  // Keep as string if invalid
      }
    }
    return val;
  },
  
  // On WRITE (create/update): Stringify objects to JSON
  postprocess({ val, field }) {
    if (field.options === "JSON" && typeof val === "object" && val !== null) {
      return JSON.stringify(val);
    }
    return val;
  }
};
```

## Why This Works

1. **Already integrated**: Your `_applyFieldTypeHandlers()` loops through schema fields and calls handlers
2. **Automatic**: Runs for every Code field with `options: "JSON"` (like `config`, `functions`)
3. **Bidirectional**:
   - **CREATE/UPDATE**: `postprocess` converts `{base_url: "..."}` → `"{\"base_url\":\"...\"}"`
   - **SELECT/TAKEONE**: `preprocess` converts back to objects
4. **DB-agnostic**: Works with any adapter

## Where It Runs
```
CREATE flow:
  input: { config: {base_url: "..."} }  ← Object
    ↓
  Tier 2: postprocess
    ↓
  processedDoc: { config: "{\"base_url\":\"...\"}" }  ← String
    ↓
  _dbCreate(processedDoc)  ← Adapter receives string

SELECT flow:
  _dbQuery returns: { config: "{\"base_url\":\"...\"}" }  ← String from DB
    ↓
  Tier 2: preprocess
    ↓
  run_doc.output.data[0]: { config: {base_url: "..."} }  ← Object

Important: UPDATE Handler Needs Processing Too

Your UPDATE handler doesn't call processDocument(), so it skips field handlers. You need to either:

Option A: Call processDocument() in update handler Option B: Manually apply field handlers in update handler

Which approach do you prefer?

deserialization

5:10 PM

Good question! Let's trace deserialization (JSON string → object) through your architecture:

Current Flow for SELECT/TAKEONE

javascript
// 1. DB returns raw data
_dbQuery() → { config: "{\"base_url\":\"...\"}" }  // String from DB

// 2. Handler returns data
_handlers.select() → {
  output: {
    data: [{ config: "{\"base_url\":\"...\"}" }]  // Still string
  }
}

// 3. User receives string
run_doc.output.data[0].config  // Still string!

Problem: No Deserialization Happening

Your field system's preprocess is only called during WRITE operations (create/update) via processDocument().

SELECT/TAKEONE don't call processDocument() - they return raw DB data.

Where Should Deserialization Happen?

Option 1: In SELECT Handler (After DB Query)

javascript
coworker._handlers.select = async function (run_doc) {
  // ... existing code ...
  
  const { data, meta } = await coworker._dbQuery(params, take, skip);
  
  // ✅ DESERIALIZE: Apply field preprocessing to each record
  if (schema?.fields) {
    for (const record of data) {
      for (const field of schema.fields) {
        const handler = coworker._fieldHandlers?.[field.fieldtype];
        if (handler?.preprocess) {
          record[field.fieldname] = handler.preprocess({
            val: record[field.fieldname],
            field,
            doc: record,
            doctype: source_doctype,
            run_doc
          });
        }
      }
    }
  }
  
  // ... rest of handler ...
};

Option 2: In DB Adapter (Universal)

javascript
// In pb-adapter-pocketbase.js
async query(params) {
  const records = await pb.collection('item').getFullList(params);
  
  // ✅ DESERIALIZE: Apply to all records
  const schema = await coworker.getSchema(records[0]?.doctype);
  return {
    data: records.map(rec => this._deserializeRecord(rec, schema)),
    meta: { ... }
  };
}

_deserializeRecord(record, schema) {
  if (!schema?.fields) return record;
  
  for (const field of schema.fields) {
    const handler = coworker._fieldHandlers?.[field.fieldtype];
    if (handler?.preprocess) {
      record[field.fieldname] = handler.preprocess({
        val: record[field.fieldname],
        field
      });
    }
  }
  return record;
}

Option 3: Unified Processing Function (Cleanest)

javascript
// Add to coworker-field-system.js
coworker.deserializeDocument = async function(doc, doctype, operation = 'select') {
  const schema = await this.getSchema(doctype);
  
  if (!schema?.fields) return doc;
  
  for (const field of schema.fields) {
    const handler = this._fieldHandlers?.[field.fieldtype];
    if (handler?.preprocess) {
      doc[field.fieldname] = handler.preprocess({
        val: doc[field.fieldname],
        field,
        doc,
        doctype
      });
    }
  }
  
  return doc;
};

// Then in SELECT handler:
const { data } = await coworker._dbQuery(params);
const deserialized = await Promise.all(
  data.map(rec => coworker.deserializeDocument(rec, source_doctype))
);

Recommendation

Option 3 is cleanest because:

  • Symmetric with processDocument() (serialize)
  • Reusable across all read operations
  • Keeps handlers simple
  • Single source of truth for deserialization

Which approach fits your architecture vision?

agreed to make in field-system, give me full field-system corrected with serialization - deserialization

5:13 PM
javascript
// ============================================================================
// COWORKER-FIELD-SYSTEM.JS
// Three-tier document processing system + Serialization/Deserialization
// ============================================================================

// ============================================================================
// FIELD TYPE HANDLERS REGISTRY
// ============================================================================

coworker._fieldHandlers = coworker._fieldHandlers || {};

// Code field handler (JSON serialization/deserialization)
coworker._fieldHandlers.Code = {
  // On READ: Parse JSON strings to objects
  preprocess({ val, field }) {
    if (field.options === "JSON" && typeof val === "string" && val) {
      try {
        return JSON.parse(val);
      } catch (e) {
        console.warn(`Failed to parse JSON for ${field.fieldname}:`, e);
        return val;  // Keep as string if invalid
      }
    }
    return val;
  },
  
  // On WRITE: Stringify objects to JSON
  postprocess({ val, field }) {
    if (field.options === "JSON" && typeof val === "object" && val !== null) {
      return JSON.stringify(val);
    }
    return val;
  }
};

// ============================================================================
// TIER 1: SYSTEM FIELD RULES
// ============================================================================

coworker._applySystemFieldRules = async function(run_doc) {
  const { operation } = run_doc;
  
  // Get the correct doctype based on operation
  const doctype = run_doc.target_doctype || run_doc.source_doctype;
  
  // Get the document being processed
  const doc = run_doc.input?.data;
  if (!doc) {
    throw new Error('No document data in run_doc.input.data');
  }
  
  // Fetch schema - check output first (if already fetched), then fetch if needed
  let schema = run_doc.output?.schema;
  if (!schema) {
    schema = await this.getSchema(doctype);
    // Store it in run_doc for reuse (but not in output yet)
    run_doc._schema = schema;
  }

  // Get applicable rules, sorted by priority
  const rules = Object.entries(this._systemFieldRules || {})
    .filter(([fname, rule]) => {
      if (!rule) return false;

      if (rule.applies_to === 'all') return true;
      if (rule.applies_to === 'specific') {
        return rule.specific_doctypes?.includes(doctype);
      }
      if (rule.applies_to === 'submittable') return schema?.is_submittable;
      if (rule.applies_to === 'child_tables') return schema?.istable;

      return false;
    })
    .sort((a, b) => (a[1].priority || 100) - (b[1].priority || 100));

  // Apply each rule
  for (const [fieldname, rule] of rules) {
    // Auto-generate value
    if (rule.auto_set_on === operation || rule.auto_set_on === 'both') {
      if (rule.generator && doc[fieldname] == null) {
        doc[fieldname] = await rule.generator({ 
          doc, 
          operation, 
          doctype,
          run_doc,
          user: run_doc.owner,
          schema
        });
      } else if (rule.defaultValue && doc[fieldname] == null) {
        doc[fieldname] = rule.defaultValue;
      } else if (rule.defaultFn && doc[fieldname] == null) {
        doc[fieldname] = await rule.defaultFn({ doc, run_doc, schema });
      }
    }

    // Validate required
    if (rule.required_on === 'always' || rule.required_on === operation) {
      if (doc[fieldname] == null || doc[fieldname] === '') {
        throw new Error(`${fieldname} is required`);
      }
    }

    // Custom validation
    if (rule.validate) {
      const error = await rule.validate({ 
        val: doc[fieldname], 
        doc, 
        operation, 
        doctype,
        run_doc,
        schema
      });
      if (error) throw new Error(error);
    }
  }

  console.log(`  ✅ Tier 1: Applied ${rules.length} system field rules`);
};


// ============================================================================
// TIER 2: FIELD TYPE HANDLERS
// ============================================================================

coworker._applyFieldTypeHandlers = async function(run_doc) {
  const doctype = run_doc.target_doctype || run_doc.source_doctype;
  const doc = run_doc.input?.data;
  
  if (!doc) {
    throw new Error('No document data in run_doc.input.data');
  }
  
  // Get schema from run_doc or fetch it
  let schema = run_doc.output?.schema || run_doc._schema;
  if (!schema) {
    schema = await this.getSchema(doctype);
    run_doc._schema = schema;
  }

  if (!schema?.fields) return;

  let processedCount = 0;

  for (const field of schema.fields) {
    const handler = this._fieldHandlers?.[field.fieldtype];
    if (!handler) continue;

    const val = doc[field.fieldname];

    // Preprocess (normalize/cast)
    if (handler.preprocess) {
      doc[field.fieldname] = handler.preprocess({ 
        val, 
        field, 
        doc,
        doctype,
        run_doc
      });
    }

    // Postprocess (transform before save)
    if (handler.postprocess) {
      doc[field.fieldname] = handler.postprocess({
        val: doc[field.fieldname],
        field,
        doc,
        doctype,
        run_doc
      });
    }

    // Sync validation
    if (handler.validate) {
      const error = handler.validate(doc[field.fieldname], field);
      if (error) throw new Error(`${field.fieldname}: ${error}`);
    }

    // Async validation
    if (handler.validateAsync) {
      const error = await handler.validateAsync({
        val: doc[field.fieldname],
        field,
        doc,
        doctype,
        run_doc
      });
      if (error) throw new Error(`${field.fieldname}: ${error}`);
    }

    processedCount++;
  }

  console.log(`  ✅ Tier 2: Processed ${processedCount} fields`);
};


// ============================================================================
// TIER 3: CUSTOM FIELD RULES (PLACEHOLDER)
// ============================================================================

coworker._applyCustomFieldRules = async function(run_doc) {
  // Tier 3: Custom business rules
  // This is where you would add:
  // - Computed fields (e.g., total = quantity * rate)
  // - Cross-field validation (e.g., end_date > start_date)
  // - Domain-specific business logic
  
  const doctype = run_doc.target_doctype || run_doc.source_doctype;
  const doc = run_doc.input?.data;
  
  if (!doc) {
    throw new Error('No document data in run_doc.input.data');
  }
  
  // Example: Add custom rules here when needed
  // if (doctype === 'Invoice') {
  //   doc.total = doc.quantity * doc.rate;
  // }
  
  console.log(`  ⏭️  Tier 3: Custom rules (not implemented)`);
};


// ============================================================================
// SERIALIZATION: For WRITE operations (create/update)
// ============================================================================

coworker.processDocument = async function(run_doc) {
  const { operation } = run_doc;
  const doctype = run_doc.target_doctype || run_doc.source_doctype;
  
  // Validate we have document data
  if (!run_doc.input?.data) {
    throw new Error('run_doc.input.data is required for document processing');
  }
  
  console.log(`🔧 Processing document: ${doctype} (${operation})`);

  // All tiers receive run_doc
  await this._applySystemFieldRules(run_doc);
  await this._applyFieldTypeHandlers(run_doc);  // ← postprocess serializes
  await this._applyCustomFieldRules(run_doc);

  console.log(`✅ Document processed: ${run_doc.input.data.name || 'unnamed'}`);

  return run_doc.input.data;  // Return the processed document
};


// ============================================================================
// DESERIALIZATION: For READ operations (select/takeone)
// ============================================================================

coworker.deserializeDocument = async function(doc, doctype) {
  if (!doc || typeof doc !== 'object') return doc;
  
  // Fetch schema
  const schema = await this.getSchema(doctype);
  if (!schema?.fields) return doc;

  // Apply preprocess to each field
  for (const field of schema.fields) {
    const handler = this._fieldHandlers?.[field.fieldtype];
    if (handler?.preprocess) {
      doc[field.fieldname] = handler.preprocess({
        val: doc[field.fieldname],
        field,
        doc,
        doctype
      });
    }
  }

  return doc;
};

// Batch deserialization helper
coworker.deserializeDocuments = async function(docs, doctype) {
  if (!Array.isArray(docs) || docs.length === 0) return docs;
  
  return await Promise.all(
    docs.map(doc => this.deserializeDocument(doc, doctype))
  );
};


// ============================================================================
// CREATE HANDLER (with serialization)
// ============================================================================

coworker._handlers.create = async function (run_doc) {
  const { target_doctype, input, options } = run_doc;
  const { includeSchema = true, includeMeta = false } = options || {};

  // ✅ Accept both wrapped (input.data) and unwrapped (input) formats
  const inputData = input?.data || input;

  if (!inputData || Object.keys(inputData).length === 0) {
    throw new Error("CREATE requires input with data");
  }

  // Ensure input.data exists with doctype for 3-tier system
  run_doc.input = run_doc.input || {};
  run_doc.input.data = {
    ...inputData,
    doctype: target_doctype
  };

  // ✅ RUN THE 3-TIER ENGINE (includes serialization via postprocess)
  const processedDoc = await coworker.processDocument(run_doc);

  // Execute via adapter (processedDoc has serialized JSON strings)
  const result = await coworker._dbCreate(processedDoc);

  // ✅ DESERIALIZE the returned document
  const deserializedDoc = await coworker.deserializeDocument(
    result.data,
    target_doctype
  );

  // Store schema in output if we fetched it
  const schema = run_doc._schema || (includeSchema ? await coworker.getSchema(target_doctype) : undefined);

  return {
    success: true,
    output: {
      data: [deserializedDoc],  // ← Deserialized for user
      schema: includeSchema ? schema : undefined,
      meta: includeMeta ? { operation: 'create', created: 1 } : undefined
    }
  };
};


// ============================================================================
// INITIALIZATION
// ============================================================================

console.log('✅ Field system loaded (3-tier processing + serialization)');

Key Changes:

  1. Added _fieldHandlers.Code - Handles JSON serialization/deserialization
  2. Added deserializeDocument() - Symmetric to processDocument()
  3. Added deserializeDocuments() - Batch helper for arrays
  4. Updated CREATE handler - Deserializes result before returning

Next Steps:

  1. Update SELECT/TAKEONE handlers to call deserializeDocuments()
  2. Update UPDATE handler to call both processDocument() (serialize) and deserializeDocument() (on result)

why SELECT/TAKEONE even need to think about serizalization

5:15 PM

Excellent question! Let me trace what happens:

DB Storage Reality

PocketBase stores:
{
  adapter_name: "JSONPlaceholder",
  config: "{\"base_url\":\"https://...\",\"timeout\":5000}"  ← STRING in DB
}

Without Deserialization in SELECT

javascript
const result = await coworker.run({
  operation: "select",
  doctype: "Adapter"
});

// User gets:
result.output.data[0].config  
// → "{\"base_url\":\"https://...\",\"timeout\":5000}"  ← STRING!

// User must manually:
const config = JSON.parse(result.output.data[0].config);

With Deserialization in SELECT

javascript
const result = await coworker.run({
  operation: "select",
  doctype: "Adapter"
});

// User gets:
result.output.data[0].config  
// → { base_url: "https://...", timeout: 5000 }  ← OBJECT!

// Ready to use:
fetch(result.output.data[0].config.base_url)

Why This Matters

Your adapter function expects objects:

javascript
async function get_post(run_doc) {
  // This only works if config is already an OBJECT
  const url = run_doc.adapter.config.base_url + '/posts/' + run_doc.input.id;
  //                           ^^^^^^^^^ needs to be object, not string
}

The Pattern

  • WRITE (create/update): User provides objects → serialize to strings → DB stores strings
  • READ (select/takeone): DB returns strings → deserialize to objects → User gets objects

SELECT needs deserialization to be symmetric with CREATE's serialization.

Without it, you break the abstraction: users would need to know which fields are JSON-stringified in the DB.

i mean that spread controlling functions. its in run.select, field-system. I also have controller 

// ============================================================
// COWORKER-CONTROLLER.JS - PRODUCTION READY
// Version: 5.0.0 - Centralized Draft, Smart Validation
// ============================================================

// ============================================================
// COWORKER VALIDATORS
// ============================================================

coworker.validators = {
  /**
   * Validate field based on fieldtype and properties
   */
  validateField(field, value) {
    // Required check
    if (field.reqd && (value == null || value === "")) {
      return `${field.label || field.fieldname} is required`;
    }

    // Skip if no value
    if (value == null || value === "") return null;

    // Type validation
    const typeChecks = {
      Int: (v) => Number.isInteger(Number(v)),
      Float: (v) => !isNaN(Number(v)),
      Email: (v) => /^\S+@\S+\.\S+$/.test(v),
      Date: (v) => !isNaN(Date.parse(v)),
    };

    if (typeChecks[field.fieldtype] && !typeChecks[field.fieldtype](value)) {
      return `${field.label || field.fieldname} must be valid ${field.fieldtype}`;
    }

    // Length validation
    if (field.length && value.length > field.length) {
      return `${field.label || field.fieldname} exceeds max length ${field.length}`;
    }

    // Range validation
    if (field.min_value != null && Number(value) < field.min_value) {
      return `${field.label || field.fieldname} minimum is ${field.min_value}`;
    }
    if (field.max_value != null && Number(value) > field.max_value) {
      return `${field.label || field.fieldname} maximum is ${field.max_value}`;
    }

    return null;
  },
};

// ============================================================
// COWORKER CONTROLLER
// ============================================================

coworker.controller = {
  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
  // UNIVERSAL EXECUTOR (Config-Driven)
  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

  async execute(run_doc) {
    const { operation, options = {} } = run_doc;

    // ✅ SINGLE SOURCE OF TRUTH: Set draft from operation config
    if (options.draft === undefined) {
      const opConfig = coworker._config.operations[operation];
      run_doc.options = run_doc.options || {};
      run_doc.options.draft = opConfig?.draft ?? false;
    }

    // ✅ ESCAPE HATCH: Skip controller entirely
    if (options.skipController) {
      return await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
    }

    // ✅ Get operation config (default if not found)
    const opConfig = coworker._config.operations[operation] || {
      type: "custom",
      requiresSchema: false,
      validate: false,
      fetchOriginals: false,
    };

    // ✅ Fetch schema if needed (use correct doctype)
    if (opConfig.requiresSchema && !options.skipSchema) {
      if (!run_doc.output) run_doc.output = {};

      // ✅ Use source_doctype for reads/updates, target_doctype for creates
      const doctype = run_doc.source_doctype || run_doc.target_doctype;

      if (!run_doc.output.schema && doctype && doctype !== "Schema") {
        const schema = await coworker.getSchema(doctype);
        run_doc.output.schema = schema;
      }
    }

    // ✅ Route based on type
    if (opConfig.type === "read") {
      return await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
    }

    if (opConfig.type === "write") {
      if (options.skipValidation || !opConfig.validate) {
        return await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
      }
      return await this._processWrite(run_doc, opConfig);
    }

    // Custom operations - pass through
    return await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
  },

  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
  // WRITE OPERATIONS (Validation Layer)
  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

  async _processWrite(run_doc, opConfig) {
    const { operation, input, query } = run_doc;

    // ✅ Get correct doctype based on operation
    // - CREATE/INSERT: target_doctype (writing TO new)
    // - UPDATE/DELETE: source_doctype (reading FROM existing)
    const doctype = run_doc.source_doctype || run_doc.target_doctype;

    const schema = run_doc.output?.schema;

    // ✅ Fetch originals if config says so
    let items = [];
    if (opConfig.fetchOriginals && query?.where) {
      const filter = coworker._buildPrismaWhere(doctype, query.where);
      const result = await coworker._dbQuery({ filter });
      items = result.data;

      if (items.length === 0) {
        return {
          success: true,
          output: {
            data: [],
            schema,
            meta: { operation, affected: 0 },
          },
        };
      }
    }

    // ✅ Validate based on config
    if (opConfig.validate) {
      // ✅ Accept both wrapped (input.data) and unwrapped (input) formats
      const inputData = input?.data || input;

      // For operations that fetch originals (UPDATE), validate merged
      if (items.length > 0) {
        for (const item of items) {
          const merged = { ...item, ...inputData };
          const validation = this._validate(merged, schema);
          if (!validation.valid) {
            return { success: false, errors: validation.errors };
          }
        }
      }
      // For operations that don't fetch (CREATE), validate input
      else {
        const validation = this._validate(inputData, schema);
        if (!validation.valid) {
          return { success: false, errors: validation.errors };
        }
      }
    }

    // ✅ Pass fetched items to handler (avoid double fetch)
    if (items.length > 0) {
      run_doc._items = items;
    }

    // Execute via handler
    return await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
  },

  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
  // VALIDATION HELPERS
  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

  _validate(doc, schema) {
    if (!schema) return { valid: true, errors: [] };

    const errors = [];
    schema.fields.forEach((field) => {
      const error = coworker.validators.validateField(
        field,
        doc[field.fieldname]
      );
      if (error) errors.push(error);
    });

    return { valid: !errors.length, errors };
  },

  validate(run) {
    const errors = [];

    run.output?.schema?.fields.forEach((field) => {
      const error = coworker.validators.validateField(
        field,
        run.doc[field.fieldname]
      );
      if (error) errors.push(error);
    });

    return { valid: !errors.length, errors };
  },

  isComplete(run) {
    return this.validate(run).valid;
  },

  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
  // DRAFT MODE HELPERS (UI Form Support)
  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

  async save(run) {
    // ✅ Check draft flag (set by execute())
    if (!run.options?.draft) {
      console.warn("save() called on non-draft run");
      return {
        success: false,
        error: { message: "Document not in draft mode" },
      };
    }

    if (run._saving) {
      console.warn("save() already in progress");
      return { success: false, error: { message: "Save in progress" } };
    }

    // Validate
    const validation = this.validate(run);
    if (!validation.valid) {
      run._validationErrors = validation.errors;
      if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
        coworker._render(run);
      }
      return { success: false, errors: validation.errors };
    }

    // ✅ MERGE: original + delta
    const original = run.output?.data?.[0] || {};
    const delta = run.input || {};
    const merged = { ...original, ...delta };

    // Determine if new or update
    const isNew = !merged.name || merged.name.startsWith("new-");

    // ✅ Get doctype from parent run (works for both create and update)
    const doctype = run.source_doctype || run.target_doctype;

    if (!doctype) {
      console.error("save() requires doctype");
      return {
        success: false,
        error: { message: "No doctype found in run" }
      };
    }

    // Save
    run._saving = true;
    if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
      coworker._render(run);
    }

    try {
      const saveRun = await run.child({
        operation: isNew ? "create" : "update",
        
        // ✅ Pass both doctypes - resolver will use the correct one
        source_doctype: doctype,
        target_doctype: doctype,
        
        input: merged,
        query: isNew ? undefined : { where: { name: merged.name } },
        options: {
          includeSchema: false,
        },
      });

      if (saveRun.success) {
        // Update local state
        run.output.data = [saveRun.output.data[0]];
        run.input = {};
        delete run._saving;
        delete run._validationErrors;

        // ✅ Re-render to show updated state (buttons may change based on docstatus)
        if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
          coworker._render(run);
        }

        return { success: true, data: saveRun.output.data[0] };
      } else {
        run._saveError = saveRun.error?.message;
        delete run._saving;

        if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
          coworker._render(run);
        }

        return { success: false, error: saveRun.error };
      }
    } catch (error) {
      run._saveError = error.message;
      delete run._saving;

      if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
        coworker._render(run);
      }

      return { success: false, error: { message: error.message } };
    }
  },

  async autoSave(run) {
    // ✅ Check draft flag (set by execute())
    if (!run.options?.draft) return;
    if (run._saving) return;

    // ✅ Schema-level autosave control
    const schema = run.output?.schema;

    if (schema?.is_submittable === 1) {
      const autosave = schema._autosave !== undefined ? schema._autosave : 1;

      if (autosave === 0) {
        console.log("🚫 AutoSave BLOCKED: _autosave=0 for", schema._schema_doctype);
        return;
      }

      if (run.doc?.docstatus !== 0) {
        console.log("🚫 AutoSave BLOCKED: docstatus != 0");
        return;
      }
    }

    if (!this.isComplete(run)) {
      if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
        coworker._render(run);
      }
      return;
    }

    console.log("✅ AutoSave proceeding to save()");
    return await this.save(run);
  }
};

console.log('✅ Controller loaded: v5.0.0 - Centralized draft, smart validation');
5:17 PM

Ah, you're asking about separation of concerns - who should handle deserialization?

Current Architecture Layers

┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
│  coworker.run()                     │  Orchestration
│  - Builds run_doc                   │
│  - Calls controller.execute()       │
└─────────────┬───────────────────────┘
              ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
│  controller.execute()               │  Routing & Validation
│  - Fetches schema                   │
│  - Routes to handlers               │
│  - Validates (for writes)           │
└─────────────┬───────────────────────┘
              ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
│  _handlers.select()                 │  CRUD Logic
│  - Calls _dbQuery()                 │
│  - Filters fields by view           │
│  - Returns output                   │
└─────────────┬───────────────────────┘
              ↓
┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
│  field-system (processDocument)     │  Field Processing
│  - Tier 1: System rules             │
│  - Tier 2: Type handlers            │  ← Serialization happens here
│  - Tier 3: Custom rules             │
└─────────────────────────────────────┘

The Question: Where Does Deserialization Fit?

Option A: In SELECT Handler (Current)

javascript
_handlers.select = async function(run_doc) {
  const { data } = await coworker._dbQuery(params);
  
  // ❌ Handler knows about field types
  const deserialized = await coworker.deserializeDocuments(data, doctype);
  
  return { output: { data: deserialized } };
}

Problem: Handler is doing field-level work (violates single responsibility)

Option B: In Controller (After Handler)

javascript
controller.execute = async function(run_doc) {
  // ... routing ...
  
  const result = await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
  
  // ✅ Controller post-processes all read operations
  if (opConfig.type === "read" && result.output?.data) {
    const doctype = run_doc.source_doctype || run_doc.target_doctype;
    result.output.data = await coworker.deserializeDocuments(
      result.output.data,
      doctype
    );
  }
  
  return result;
}

Benefits:

  • Symmetric: Write validation in controller → Read deserialization in controller
  • Centralized: One place for all read operations
  • Handler stays pure: Just CRUD logic, no field processing
  • Consistent: All SELECT/TAKEONE/etc. get automatic deserialization

Option C: In Field System (Separate Function)

Keep deserializeDocuments() in field-system, but call it from controller, not handlers.

Recommendation: Option B (Controller)

javascript
controller.execute = async function(run_doc) {
  // ... existing code ...

  // ✅ Route based on type
  if (opConfig.type === "read") {
    const result = await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
    
    // ✅ Auto-deserialize all read operations
    if (result.output?.data && Array.isArray(result.output.data)) {
      const doctype = run_doc.source_doctype || run_doc.target_doctype;
      result.output.data = await coworker.deserializeDocuments(
        result.output.data,
        doctype
      );
    }
    
    return result;
  }

  if (opConfig.type === "write") {
    // ... existing write logic ...
  }
}

This way:

  • ✅ Handlers stay simple (just CRUD)
  • ✅ Controller handles all cross-cutting concerns
  • ✅ Field system provides the tooling
  • ✅ Symmetric with write validation

Want me to show the updated controller with this pattern?

and with B we dont change handlers, correct?

5:18 PM

Correct! With Option B, handlers remain unchanged.

What Changes

✅ Controller (coworker-controller.js)

javascript
// Add deserialization after read operations
if (opConfig.type === "read") {
  const result = await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
  
  // Auto-deserialize
  if (result.output?.data && Array.isArray(result.output.data)) {
    const doctype = run_doc.source_doctype || run_doc.target_doctype;
    result.output.data = await coworker.deserializeDocuments(
      result.output.data,
      doctype
    );
  }
  
  return result;
}

❌ Handlers (NO CHANGES)

javascript
// _handlers.select stays exactly as-is
_handlers.select = async function(run_doc) {
  // ... existing code ...
  const { data } = await coworker._dbQuery(params);
  return { success: true, output: { data, schema, meta } };
  // No deserialization here!
}

// _handlers.takeone stays exactly as-is
_handlers.takeone = async function(run_doc) {
  // ... existing code ...
}
```

## Flow
```
Handler returns raw DB strings:
  { config: "{\"base_url\":\"...\"}" }
        ↓
Controller intercepts (type === "read"):
        ↓
Calls deserializeDocuments():
        ↓
Returns to user as objects:
  { config: { base_url: "..." } }

Benefits:

  • Handlers don't know about deserialization
  • Controller acts as a consistent post-processor for all reads
  • Symmetric with how controller does pre-validation for all writes

Should I provide the updated controller code with this addition?

yes, lets implement, serialization and deserialization as B

5:19 PM
javascript
// ============================================================
// COWORKER-CONTROLLER.JS - PRODUCTION READY
// Version: 5.1.0 - Centralized Draft, Smart Validation, Auto-Serialization
// ============================================================

// ============================================================
// COWORKER VALIDATORS
// ============================================================

coworker.validators = {
  /**
   * Validate field based on fieldtype and properties
   */
  validateField(field, value) {
    // Required check
    if (field.reqd && (value == null || value === "")) {
      return `${field.label || field.fieldname} is required`;
    }

    // Skip if no value
    if (value == null || value === "") return null;

    // Type validation
    const typeChecks = {
      Int: (v) => Number.isInteger(Number(v)),
      Float: (v) => !isNaN(Number(v)),
      Email: (v) => /^\S+@\S+\.\S+$/.test(v),
      Date: (v) => !isNaN(Date.parse(v)),
    };

    if (typeChecks[field.fieldtype] && !typeChecks[field.fieldtype](value)) {
      return `${field.label || field.fieldname} must be valid ${field.fieldtype}`;
    }

    // Length validation
    if (field.length && value.length > field.length) {
      return `${field.label || field.fieldname} exceeds max length ${field.length}`;
    }

    // Range validation
    if (field.min_value != null && Number(value) < field.min_value) {
      return `${field.label || field.fieldname} minimum is ${field.min_value}`;
    }
    if (field.max_value != null && Number(value) > field.max_value) {
      return `${field.label || field.fieldname} maximum is ${field.max_value}`;
    }

    return null;
  },
};

// ============================================================
// COWORKER CONTROLLER
// ============================================================

coworker.controller = {
  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
  // UNIVERSAL EXECUTOR (Config-Driven)
  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

  async execute(run_doc) {
    const { operation, options = {} } = run_doc;

    // ✅ SINGLE SOURCE OF TRUTH: Set draft from operation config
    if (options.draft === undefined) {
      const opConfig = coworker._config.operations[operation];
      run_doc.options = run_doc.options || {};
      run_doc.options.draft = opConfig?.draft ?? false;
    }

    // ✅ ESCAPE HATCH: Skip controller entirely
    if (options.skipController) {
      return await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
    }

    // ✅ Get operation config (default if not found)
    const opConfig = coworker._config.operations[operation] || {
      type: "custom",
      requiresSchema: false,
      validate: false,
      fetchOriginals: false,
    };

    // ✅ Fetch schema if needed (use correct doctype)
    if (opConfig.requiresSchema && !options.skipSchema) {
      if (!run_doc.output) run_doc.output = {};

      // ✅ Use source_doctype for reads/updates, target_doctype for creates
      const doctype = run_doc.source_doctype || run_doc.target_doctype;

      if (!run_doc.output.schema && doctype && doctype !== "Schema") {
        const schema = await coworker.getSchema(doctype);
        run_doc.output.schema = schema;
      }
    }

    // ✅ Route based on type
    if (opConfig.type === "read") {
      const result = await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
      
      // ✅ AUTO-DESERIALIZE: Convert JSON strings to objects
      if (result.output?.data && Array.isArray(result.output.data)) {
        const doctype = run_doc.source_doctype || run_doc.target_doctype;
        if (doctype) {
          result.output.data = await coworker.deserializeDocuments(
            result.output.data,
            doctype
          );
        }
      }
      
      return result;
    }

    if (opConfig.type === "write") {
      if (options.skipValidation || !opConfig.validate) {
        return await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
      }
      return await this._processWrite(run_doc, opConfig);
    }

    // Custom operations - pass through
    return await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
  },

  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
  // WRITE OPERATIONS (Validation Layer)
  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

  async _processWrite(run_doc, opConfig) {
    const { operation, input, query } = run_doc;

    // ✅ Get correct doctype based on operation
    // - CREATE/INSERT: target_doctype (writing TO new)
    // - UPDATE/DELETE: source_doctype (reading FROM existing)
    const doctype = run_doc.source_doctype || run_doc.target_doctype;

    const schema = run_doc.output?.schema;

    // ✅ Fetch originals if config says so
    let items = [];
    if (opConfig.fetchOriginals && query?.where) {
      const filter = coworker._buildPrismaWhere(doctype, query.where);
      const result = await coworker._dbQuery({ filter });
      items = result.data;

      if (items.length === 0) {
        return {
          success: true,
          output: {
            data: [],
            schema,
            meta: { operation, affected: 0 },
          },
        };
      }
    }

    // ✅ Validate based on config
    if (opConfig.validate) {
      // ✅ Accept both wrapped (input.data) and unwrapped (input) formats
      const inputData = input?.data || input;

      // For operations that fetch originals (UPDATE), validate merged
      if (items.length > 0) {
        for (const item of items) {
          const merged = { ...item, ...inputData };
          const validation = this._validate(merged, schema);
          if (!validation.valid) {
            return { success: false, errors: validation.errors };
          }
        }
      }
      // For operations that don't fetch (CREATE), validate input
      else {
        const validation = this._validate(inputData, schema);
        if (!validation.valid) {
          return { success: false, errors: validation.errors };
        }
      }
    }

    // ✅ Pass fetched items to handler (avoid double fetch)
    if (items.length > 0) {
      run_doc._items = items;
    }

    // Execute via handler
    return await coworker._handlers[operation](run_doc);
  },

  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
  // VALIDATION HELPERS
  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

  _validate(doc, schema) {
    if (!schema) return { valid: true, errors: [] };

    const errors = [];
    schema.fields.forEach((field) => {
      const error = coworker.validators.validateField(
        field,
        doc[field.fieldname]
      );
      if (error) errors.push(error);
    });

    return { valid: !errors.length, errors };
  },

  validate(run) {
    const errors = [];

    run.output?.schema?.fields.forEach((field) => {
      const error = coworker.validators.validateField(
        field,
        run.doc[field.fieldname]
      );
      if (error) errors.push(error);
    });

    return { valid: !errors.length, errors };
  },

  isComplete(run) {
    return this.validate(run).valid;
  },

  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
  // DRAFT MODE HELPERS (UI Form Support)
  // ══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

  async save(run) {
    // ✅ Check draft flag (set by execute())
    if (!run.options?.draft) {
      console.warn("save() called on non-draft run");
      return {
        success: false,
        error: { message: "Document not in draft mode" },
      };
    }

    if (run._saving) {
      console.warn("save() already in progress");
      return { success: false, error: { message: "Save in progress" } };
    }

    // Validate
    const validation = this.validate(run);
    if (!validation.valid) {
      run._validationErrors = validation.errors;
      if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
        coworker._render(run);
      }
      return { success: false, errors: validation.errors };
    }

    // ✅ MERGE: original + delta
    const original = run.output?.data?.[0] || {};
    const delta = run.input || {};
    const merged = { ...original, ...delta };

    // Determine if new or update
    const isNew = !merged.name || merged.name.startsWith("new-");

    // ✅ Get doctype from parent run (works for both create and update)
    const doctype = run.source_doctype || run.target_doctype;

    if (!doctype) {
      console.error("save() requires doctype");
      return {
        success: false,
        error: { message: "No doctype found in run" }
      };
    }

    // Save
    run._saving = true;
    if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
      coworker._render(run);
    }

    try {
      const saveRun = await run.child({
        operation: isNew ? "create" : "update",
        
        // ✅ Pass both doctypes - resolver will use the correct one
        source_doctype: doctype,
        target_doctype: doctype,
        
        input: merged,
        query: isNew ? undefined : { where: { name: merged.name } },
        options: {
          includeSchema: false,
        },
      });

      if (saveRun.success) {
        // Update local state
        run.output.data = [saveRun.output.data[0]];
        run.input = {};
        delete run._saving;
        delete run._validationErrors;

        // ✅ Re-render to show updated state (buttons may change based on docstatus)
        if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
          coworker._render(run);
        }

        return { success: true, data: saveRun.output.data[0] };
      } else {
        run._saveError = saveRun.error?.message;
        delete run._saving;

        if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
          coworker._render(run);
        }

        return { success: false, error: saveRun.error };
      }
    } catch (error) {
      run._saveError = error.message;
      delete run._saving;

      if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
        coworker._render(run);
      }

      return { success: false, error: { message: error.message } };
    }
  },

  async autoSave(run) {
    // ✅ Check draft flag (set by execute())
    if (!run.options?.draft) return;
    if (run._saving) return;

    // ✅ Schema-level autosave control
    const schema = run.output?.schema;

    if (schema?.is_submittable === 1) {
      const autosave = schema._autosave !== undefined ? schema._autosave : 1;

      if (autosave === 0) {
        console.log("🚫 AutoSave BLOCKED: _autosave=0 for", schema._schema_doctype);
        return;
      }

      if (run.doc?.docstatus !== 0) {
        console.log("🚫 AutoSave BLOCKED: docstatus != 0");
        return;
      }
    }

    if (!this.isComplete(run)) {
      if (typeof coworker._render === "function") {
        coworker._render(run);
      }
      return;
    }

    console.log("✅ AutoSave proceeding to save()");
    return await this.save(run);
  }
};

console.log('✅ Controller loaded: v5.1.0 - Centralized draft, smart validation, auto-serialization');
```

**Key Changes:**

1. **Version bump**: 5.0.0 → 5.1.0
2. **Added auto-deserialization** for read operations (lines 67-76)
3. **No handler changes required** - all handlers work as-is

**Flow:**
```
READ Operations:
  Handler returns raw strings from DB
    ↓
  Controller intercepts (type === "read")
    ↓
  Calls deserializeDocuments()
    ↓
  Returns objects to user

WRITE Operations:
  User provides objects
    ↓
  processDocument() serializes (in CREATE handler)
    ↓
  DB receives strings

Perfect symmetry! 🎯

now give me console IIEE to test serialization and deserialization

5:21 PM
javascript
// ============================================================================
// TEST: Serialization & Deserialization
// ============================================================================

(async function testSerializationDeserialization() {
  console.log("🧪 Testing Serialization & Deserialization\n");

  try {
    // ========================================================================
    // TEST 1: CREATE (Serialization - Objects → Strings)
    // ========================================================================
    console.log("📝 TEST 1: CREATE - Serialization");
    console.log("─".repeat(60));

    const createInput = {
      adapter_name: "TestAdapter_" + Date.now(),
      config: {
        base_url: "https://api.example.com",
        timeout: 3000,
        retry_count: 3
      },
      functions: {
        test_function: "async function(run_doc) { return run_doc; }"
      },
      disabled: 0
    };

    console.log("Input (objects):", {
      config: createInput.config,
      functions: createInput.functions
    });

    const createResult = await coworker.run({
      operation: "create",
      doctype: "Adapter",
      input: createInput
    });

    if (createResult.success) {
      console.log("✅ CREATE Success");
      console.log("Output config type:", typeof createResult.output.data[0].config);
      console.log("Output config value:", createResult.output.data[0].config);
      console.log("Output functions type:", typeof createResult.output.data[0].functions);
      console.log("Output functions value:", createResult.output.data[0].functions);
      
      // Verify deserialization happened
      if (typeof createResult.output.data[0].config === "object") {
        console.log("✅ Deserialization worked: config is an object");
      } else {
        console.log("❌ Deserialization failed: config is still a string");
      }
    } else {
      console.log("❌ CREATE Failed:", createResult.error);
      return;
    }

    const createdName = createResult.output.data[0].name;
    console.log("\n");

    // ========================================================================
    // TEST 2: SELECT (Deserialization - Strings → Objects)
    // ========================================================================
    console.log("🔍 TEST 2: SELECT - Deserialization");
    console.log("─".repeat(60));

    const selectResult = await coworker.run({
      operation: "select",
      doctype: "Adapter",
      query: {
        where: { name: createdName }
      }
    });

    if (selectResult.success && selectResult.output.data.length > 0) {
      console.log("✅ SELECT Success");
      const record = selectResult.output.data[0];
      
      console.log("Config type:", typeof record.config);
      console.log("Config value:", record.config);
      console.log("Functions type:", typeof record.functions);
      
      // Verify it's an object
      if (typeof record.config === "object" && record.config.base_url) {
        console.log("✅ Deserialization worked: Can access config.base_url =", record.config.base_url);
      } else {
        console.log("❌ Deserialization failed: Cannot access object properties");
      }

      if (typeof record.functions === "object" && record.functions.test_function) {
        console.log("✅ Deserialization worked: Can access functions.test_function");
      } else {
        console.log("❌ Deserialization failed: Cannot access function properties");
      }
    } else {
      console.log("❌ SELECT Failed:", selectResult.error);
      return;
    }

    console.log("\n");

    // ========================================================================
    // TEST 3: TAKEONE (Deserialization)
    // ========================================================================
    console.log("📋 TEST 3: TAKEONE - Deserialization");
    console.log("─".repeat(60));

    const takeoneResult = await coworker.run({
      operation: "takeone",
      doctype: "Adapter",
      query: {
        where: { name: createdName }
      }
    });

    if (takeoneResult.success) {
      console.log("✅ TAKEONE Success");
      const record = takeoneResult.output.data[0];
      
      console.log("Config type:", typeof record.config);
      console.log("Config is object:", record.config instanceof Object);
      console.log("Can access nested property:", record.config?.base_url);
      
      if (record.config?.base_url === "https://api.example.com") {
        console.log("✅ Perfect: Nested property accessible and correct");
      }
    } else {
      console.log("❌ TAKEONE Failed:", takeoneResult.error);
      return;
    }

    console.log("\n");

    // ========================================================================
    // TEST 4: UPDATE (Serialization - Objects → Strings)
    // ========================================================================
    console.log("✏️ TEST 4: UPDATE - Serialization");
    console.log("─".repeat(60));

    const updateResult = await coworker.run({
      operation: "update",
      doctype: "Adapter",
      query: {
        where: { name: createdName }
      },
      input: {
        config: {
          base_url: "https://api.example.com",
          timeout: 5000,  // Changed
          retry_count: 3,
          new_field: "added"  // Added
        }
      }
    });

    if (updateResult.success) {
      console.log("✅ UPDATE Success");
      const record = updateResult.output.data[0];
      
      console.log("Config type:", typeof record.config);
      console.log("Config value:", record.config);
      console.log("New timeout:", record.config?.timeout);
      console.log("New field:", record.config?.new_field);
      
      if (record.config?.timeout === 5000 && record.config?.new_field === "added") {
        console.log("✅ Update deserialization worked: Changes visible as objects");
      }
    } else {
      console.log("❌ UPDATE Failed:", updateResult.error || updateResult.errors);
      return;
    }

    console.log("\n");

    // ========================================================================
    // TEST 5: Verify DB Storage (Raw Query)
    // ========================================================================
    console.log("💾 TEST 5: Verify DB Storage (Raw Strings)");
    console.log("─".repeat(60));

    // Bypass deserialization to see raw DB data
    const rawResult = await coworker._dbQuery({
      filter: `name = "${createdName}"`
    });

    if (rawResult.data.length > 0) {
      const rawRecord = rawResult.data[0];
      console.log("Raw config type from DB:", typeof rawRecord.config);
      console.log("Raw config value:", rawRecord.config?.substring(0, 100) + "...");
      
      if (typeof rawRecord.config === "string") {
        console.log("✅ Correct: DB stores as JSON string");
        console.log("✅ Serialization working correctly");
      } else {
        console.log("❌ Unexpected: DB has object (should be string)");
      }
    }

    console.log("\n");

    // ========================================================================
    // TEST 6: Cleanup
    // ========================================================================
    console.log("🧹 TEST 6: Cleanup");
    console.log("─".repeat(60));

    const deleteResult = await coworker.run({
      operation: "delete",
      doctype: "Adapter",
      query: {
        where: { name: createdName }
      }
    });

    if (deleteResult.success) {
      console.log("✅ Test record deleted");
    }

    console.log("\n");
    console.log("=" .repeat(60));
    console.log("✅ ALL TESTS COMPLETED");
    console.log("=" .repeat(60));

  } catch (error) {
    console.error("❌ Test failed with error:", error);
    console.error(error.stack);
  }
})();
```

**Run this in your browser console!**

This IIFE will:
1. ✅ Test CREATE with objects → verify deserialization on return
2. ✅ Test SELECT → verify objects come back
3. ✅ Test TAKEONE → verify objects come back
4. ✅ Test UPDATE with objects → verify deserialization on return
5. ✅ Test raw DB query → verify strings are stored
6. ✅ Cleanup test data
```
